Value: Mean of observed data over all x
Slope and intercept of the best straight line through the observed  data (y)
Returns the parameters for the best fit of the observed  data (y) with a single exponential decay
y0 = last(yobs), A = first(yobs) - last(yobs), k = 0.1 * last(x)
Single exponential decay and straight line
Returns the parameters for the best fit of the observed  data (y) with a single exponential decay on top of a straight line
y = y0 + A * exp(-x * k) + slope * x
y0 = last(yobs), A = first(yobs) - last(y), k = 0.1 * last(x), slope = 0.0
Parameters for the best fit of the observed  data (y) with a double exponential decay
y = y0 + A1 * exp(-x * k1) + A2 * exp(-x * k2)
y0 = last(yobs), A1 = first(yobs) - last(yobs), k1 = 10.0 / last(x), A2 = first(yobs) - last(yobs), k2 = 1.0 / last(x)
Parameters for the best fit of the observed  data (y) with a triple exponential decay
y = y0 + A1 * exp(-x * k1) + A2 * exp(-x * k2)  + A3 * exp(-x * k3)
y0 = last(y), A1 = first(y) - last(y), k1 = 10.0 / last(x), A2 = first(y) - last(y), k2 = 1.0 / last(x), A3 =  first(y) - last(y), k3 = 0.1 / last(x)
P + L <=> PL, P + N <=> PN
Equilibrium dissociation constants KdL and KdN, and one of the extinction coefficients eL, eN, eP, ePN, ePL (others must be fixed) for the competitive binding of two ligands L and N to a protein P
p = FindRoot(KdL, KdN, Ptot, Ltot, Ntot), pl = Lt * p / (KdL * p), pn = Ntot * p / (KdN * p), [L] = Ltot - pn, n = Ntot - pn, Calc_signal = eP*p + eL*[L] + eN*n + ePL*pl + ePN*pn
p*p*p + (KdL+KdL+Lt+Nt-Ptot)*p*p + (KdL*KdN+Ltot*KdN+Nt*KdL-(KdL+KdN)*Ptot)*p - KdL*KdN*Ptot = 0, solve p within [0, Ptot]
KdL, KdN, eP, eL, eN, ePL, ePN
KdL = (max(Ltot) + min(Ltot))/2, KdN = KdL, eP = 0.0, eL = max(signal) * Ltot, eN = 0.0, ePL = max(signal) * Ptot, ePN = 0.0
Vmax and Km for initial rate (v) as a function of substrate concentration.
Vmax, Km and Ki for initial rate (v) as a function of substrate and competitive inhibitor concentrations.
v = Vmax * S / (Km + S * (1.0 + IC / Ki))
Km = max(S)/2, Vmax = max(vobs), Ki = max(S)/2
